description: YiJie Ye, who was killed in Brooklyn, had worked his way up from collecting cans to bringing New Yorkers food. A man faces a second-degree murder charge in his death.
title: Victims of Truck Rampage Grapple With Injuries as Suspect Is Charged
title_page: Victims of Truck Rampage Grapple With Injuries as Suspect Is Charged - The New York Times
maintext:
Mohamed Abdelmagid had just parked his car in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, about 11 a.m. Monday and was ambling down the sidewalk, glued to his phone as he headed to meet a friend on the next block.
He had just returned from Egypt and was watching a live feed of his sister’s sickroom there as nurses and doctors did their work. As he got closer to the intersection of Third Avenue and 72nd Streets, he glanced up.
A U-Haul truck was hurtling straight toward him.
“It was a second, two seconds, three seconds,” he said in an interview Wednesday. “No time to think about anything.”
Mr. Abdelmagid, 66, jumped out of the path of the speeding truck, but not before his right ankle was hit. He landed on his side, injuring his head, neck, knee and ribs.
